body.p:
To his Excellency the Governor of Kentucky
Your Petitioners, N N Wolford
F R Tucker & Matthew Worthington

state in the Spring of 1864 one W B Tucker was arrested charged with killing a negro & being arrested to bail in the sum of $1000 -- these petitioners became his sureties for his appearance at the next Term of the Casey Circuit Court; they state at the Nov Term of said court Tucker did appear but was not arrested but was held further on his bond, but they state a short time after said Court said Tucker was about being mobbed & being in great danger of his life he was compelled to leave his house in Casey & flee the country to save his life & in consequence thereof did not appear at the March Term of said Court. and said bond was forfeited. They state the absence of said Tucker was without any fault of them & they pray to be released from the penalties of said bond they file affidavits of Nancy Tucker for Sarah J Thomson & T B Harrison as part hereof
and they believe the statements therein are true
sworn to before me by N N Wolford March 7 1865
Z. W. Wash Exr c c,
We Join in the prayer of this Petitioner

Fon T Fox
B M Burdett
atty for Commonwealth
Protem
J. E Huffman
atty at Law
Frank Wolford
atty at Law
M J Dunham Atty
W. C. Myers
McDowell Fogle
Hiram Harris
